snippet: The site was struck multiple times by warplanes belonging to the military coalition led by Saudi Arabia, forcing evacuations, the group said.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York, and Mark Mazzetti from Washington.

abstract: Doctors Without Borders says warplanes from military coalition headed by Saudi Arabia destroyed its hospital in northern Yemen; coalition had been given hospital's coordinates; strikes against Houthi rebels raise new concerns about avoiding civilians in military operations.
lead_paragraph: The site was struck multiple times by warplanes belonging to the military coalition led by Saudi Arabia, forcing evacuations, the group said.

headline.print_headline: Saudi Coalition Destroys a Hospital in Yemen, Aid Group Says
headline.main: Doctors Without Borders Says Yemen Hospital Is Destroyed
